title: Reutlingen (Germany)
name: Reutlingen (Germany)
description:
A Map by Reutlinger

Reutlingen is a small City in the South of Germany. Living here is very comfortable because Reutlingen is big enough to offer all the Ameneties of a much bigger Towns like Theaters, public Parks or cultural Events - but small enough to avoid the drawbacks of large cities.

Have a look at some Places of my Hometown :-)

properties.name: Reutlingen Burgplatz
properties.description: Posted by ReutlingerThe Burgplatz is one of the charming Places in my Hometown. It is located only 5 Minutes away from the Marketplace and marks the upper end of the Pedestrian Zone which starts at the Railway Station. Have some icecream or fine italian espresso at the Gelateria Soravia (In the yellow Building on the first Picture), buy fresh fruits at Sakins turkish Shop or chill out in one of the many Restaurants nearby. The Burgplatz is a great Place to watch People and enjoy the happy Hour. Located on the Burgplatz is also the Headquarter (the grey building on the last Picture) of the leading regional Newspaper, the Reutlinger General-Anzeiger. You may klick on the Website of this Place to visit the Website of this Paper.

properties.name: Reutlingen Hauptbahnhof (Main Station)
properties.description: Posted by ReutlingerWhen you travel to Reutlingen by Train this is the first Building of the City you will see. If you klick on the Website of this place you will reach the official Homepage of the German Railway with the Possibility to book online. The Main Station of Reutlingen is no Beauty and the best thing is: It has two Exits. If you are hungry turn right directly in Front of the Main Station and walk on the Bahnhofstrasse only a few Meter until you reach the italian Restaurant Oliveto (Bahnhofstr. 1, 72764 Reutlingen, Phone +49 71 21 / 34 64 52 The pictures show the Main Station and the small Park in front of it and also the Entrance to the italian Restaurant Oliveto and a View inside. The Food there is very good - but expect no Bargain. One Hint: Lunch is cheaper then Dinner; between 12 am and 2 pm you can enjoy special Prices in this an many other Restaurants of Reutlingen.

properties.name: Reutlingen Karamella
properties.description: Posted by Reutlinger Reutlingen KaramellaIf you should ever visit Reutlingen - don\'t miss to enter the small Candy Store "Karamella" - located on the Wilhelmstrasse (Pedestrian Zone). This of no Advertisement, it is my declaration of love to this beautiful place where children and adults can\'t leave without beeing impressed about the huge Choice of candys from all over the world. It\'s like a fairy tale... The picture shows Susanne, the owner of Karamella, in front of her shop.

properties.name: Reutlingen Marktplatz (Marketplace)
properties.description: Posted by ReutlingerReutlingen Marktplatz MarketplaceMarketplace of the City of Reutlingen in the State of Baden-Wuerttemberg of Germany. Around 1180 Reutlingen received the market right from Staufenkaiser Friedrich I. Barbarossa. Paving stone patterns on the ground of the market place indicate the ground plan of the Renaissance guildhall. It was destroyed during the big blaze in 1726. The fountain on the market place was built by Leonhard Baumhauer in 1570 and rebuilt in 1901 by Carl Lindenberger. A sculpture representing Kaiser Maximilian II. as a knight (1527-1576) is located on the fountain column. In 1576 it was Kaiser Maximilian II. who restituted the constitution for guild trade and democracy of the imperial city Reutlingen. (Source: www.tourismus-reutlingen.de) If you would like to read more about the History of Reutlingen I recommend you this Story - written in german - of the local Newspaper of Reutlingen, the Reutlinger General-Anzeiger. It is about one of the City Guides which show the City to Tourists: Auf den Spuren von Matthäus Alber

properties.name: Reutlingen Planie (Park)
properties.description: Posted by Reutlinger  Reutlingen is a green City. The public Park Planie crosses the Centre and is a nice Place to walk and sit around. But who is this Men on his Basement? It is the German Emperor Wilhelm II (1859–1941) who has a great View in the Planie. Today the Planie is the Place where a great public Market takes place, called "Neigschmeckt". If you plan to visit Reutlingen in 2006 - maybe you can enjoy it. If you would like to read more about this "Neigschmeckt" Market I recommend you this Story - written in german - of the local Newspaper of Reutlingen, the Reutlinger General-Anzeiger: Ein Schaufenster regionaler Vielfalt

properties.name: Reutlingen Stadtgarten (Pleasure Ground)
properties.description: Posted by Reutlinger  Tired of walking in the City? Relax in one of the the Pleasure Grounds of Reutlingen. This so called Stadtgarten ist a Footway of about 5 Minutes from the Market Place away - and offers you besides a Playground for your Children a quit Place to sit on the Turf and listen to the Birds in the Trees. By the way: Reutlinger lives not far away from this Pleasure Ground. Drop me a Mail and visit my Home for a Cup of Coffee :-)

properties.name: Reutlingen Treffpunkt der Nationen
properties.description: Posted by ReutlingerReutlingen celebrates the Soccer World Championship 2006 in Germany with a big Party in the middle of the City which is called "Treffpunkt der Nationen". If you would like to see more Pictures recommend you this Gallery of the local Newspaper of Reutlingen, the Reutlinger General-Anzeiger: Bildergalerie Treffpunkt der Nationen

properties.name: Reutlingen Udo Snack
properties.description: Posted by Reutlinger Cheap and good Fast Food offers the Udo Snack in the Kaiserstrasse of Reutlingen - about 5 Minutes abway from the Main Station. Hamburger or Cheeseburger are freshly made and a lot better then the ones you could buy at Mc Do not far away.

properties.name: Reutlingen Wilhelmstrasse (Pedestrian Zone)
properties.description: Posted by ReutlingerReutlingen Wilhelmstrasse (Pedestrian Zone)The Wilhelmstraße ist the pedestrian Zone of Reutlingen. Here you can find many small shops and lots of inns, taverns and ice cream parlors. The picture shows the view in the Wilhelmstrasse and the main church of Reutlingen, the Marienkirche. If you would like to read more about the past and future of the Wilhelmstrasse I recommend you this Story - written in german - of the local Newspaper of Reutlingen, the Reutlinger General-Anzeiger: Schaufensterbummel ins Gestern
